CatDescriptText: Mrs. Irma Robertson, 2560 Breckenridge Street, practical nurse, Oakland VA Hospital, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 29, 1959, pg. A1 with question: Do you believe the state and city FEPC laws are helping Negroes to get jobs they never held before?" answer reads: "I don't know, and haven't heard of any Negroes being benefitted by these laws."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Irma Robertson wearing chair patterned short sleeve dress with bow on sleeves and brooch at collar, holding light colored handbag over left wrist, standing on sidewalk in front of light colored wall next to telephone pole
